Detailed Description

IpPortNo defines a port address of a socket. Port addresses can be specified from 0 to 65535 (please refer to according RFCs for port numbering schemes and reserved numbers. Please note that socket functions mostly require parameters in big endian format. IpPortNo takes care for you to convert the address correctly.

Member Function Documentation

UINT16 IpPortNo::GetNativePortNumber (   )  const [inline]
 

GetNativePortNumber returns port number in processor dependent byte order. Use this method if you have to print port number on display etc.

UINT16 IpPortNo::GetPortNumber (   )  const [inline]
 

GetPort returns port number in big endian format.
